column4: does anyone know how to get midi files to play in ubuntu? ive tried installing timidity but it says no configuration available or something like that
does anyone know how to get midi files to play in ubuntu? ive tried installing timidity but it says no configuration available or something like that
not sure actually.  Does timidity depend on an sample collection?
im not really sure, just on mandrake, installing timidity was all i had to do to get it working. so when thats not working now, im sure what to do
what's the error message you get?
well, the reason im trying to get them working is that i just installed doom and it works great :) except the music. it gives this: open /dev/sequencer: No such file or directory
and when i try to play a midi file i get this: /etc/timidity.cfg: No such file or directory
dpkg -L timidity | grep cfg
/usr/share/man/man5/timidity.cfg.5.gz
only that?
dpkg -L timidity | grep etc
ya
/etc
ls -l /etc/timidity.cfg /etc/timidity/
those files dont exist
okay, as a kludge, try   sudo ln -s /etc/default/timidity /etc/timidity.cfg
/etc/timidity.cfg: line 14: syntax error
ok, that doesnt work, but im reading the guide now so gimmie a few mins and il see if it helps
i think i see the problem. ubuntu doesnt provide a config file in its package. i just made one there and now i need to get a soundfont.(whatever that is :))
okay so two bugs.  one is no default config, the other is a missing dependancy on soundfont.  Can you file a Ubuntu on Bugzilla.ubuntu.com once you've figured about a solution
ok, thanks for the help
oh ffs. the soundfonts package is over 20mb. theres no way i can download that on dialup. there must be another way, frankly ubuntu should have this sorted itself
the sound fonts are the actual sounds---MIDI is just what notes to play
